alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Morgan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:38PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Morgan, western Johnson, north central Breathitt, northern Magoffin and eastern Wolfe Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 138 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burg, or 10 miles south of West Liberty, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Patton, Kernie, Wonnie, Williams, Gullett, White Oak, Hendricks and Cottle around 145 PM EDT. Mason, Licksburg, Bloomington, Tella, Elsie, Cisco, Gifford, Orient, Matthew and Logville around 150 PM EDT. Salyersville, Coon, Flat Fork, Perlie, Quod, Leatha, Cyrus, Ever, Plutarch and Brownlow around 155 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hargis, Niles, Wheelersburg, Win, Minefork, Oil Springs, Ophir, Ballot, Conley, Mima, Barnetts Creek, Elna, Redbush, Denver, Patrick, Gillem Branch, Leander, Staffordsville, Fitz, Collista and Paintsville. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 48 and 76. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern and northeastern Kentucky.
